description: Starts an Amazon EBS-backed instance that you've previously stopped.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Adversaries could rename stopped instances to appear legitimate and start them without raising alarms.
Attackers might schedule tasks to automatically start stopped instances at certain times to execute malicious actions
Once the instance is started, adversaries could transfer tools and malware to the instance for execution
Adversaries might start instances that have remote access tools installed to regain control over the environment.
Starting instances can impair defenses by creating new workloads that may not be monitored by existing security tools, enabling attackers to perform malicious activities without detection.
Attackers can directly use the StartInstances API call to manipulate the state of instances, aiding in persistence and execution of tasks.
Starting an instance can be used to stage data locally before exfiltration.

securityImplications: Attackers might use StartInstances to reactivate dormant EC2 instances or after having modified the user data for execution of commands.
